gateway.description: gateway is the host address of the ScaleIO API Gateway.

system.description: system is the name of the storage system as configured in ScaleIO.

name.title:
Name of the referent.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names
TODO: Add other useful fields. apiVersion, kind, uid?
+optional

secretRef.title:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.
+structType=atomic

sslEnabled.title:
sslEnabled Flag enable/disable SSL communication with Gateway, default false
+optional

protectionDomain.title:
protectionDomain is the name of the ScaleIO Protection Domain for the configured storage.
+optional

storagePool.title:
storagePool is the ScaleIO Storage Pool associated with the protection domain.
+optional

storageMode.title:
storageMode indicates whether the storage for a volume should be ThickProvisioned or ThinProvisioned.
Default is ThinProvisioned.
+optional

volumeName.description:
volumeName is the name of a volume already created in the ScaleIO system
that is associated with this volume source.

fsType.title:
fsType is the filesystem type to mount.
Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system.
Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs".
Default is "xfs".
+optional

readOnly.title:
readOnly Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force
the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.
+optional

title: ScaleIOVolumeSource represents a persistent ScaleIO volume
